{"step_by_step_thinking": "Anti-D is given to pregnant patients who are Rh-negative to prevent the development of Rh antibodies. Rh antibodies can cause complications in future pregnancies if the fetus is Rh-positive. The best time to give anti-D is when there is a risk of fetal-maternal hemorrhage, which can occur during certain events like amniocentesis, chorionic villus sampling, ectopic pregnancy, miscarriage, termination of pregnancy, and trauma.
